posts.title: The Future of Napchart
posts.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","markups":[],"atoms":[],"cards":[["card-markdown",{"cardName":"card-markdown","markdown":"Dear Napchart-community,

For a few years now, Napchart has been up and running. It has gone through transformations and upgrades, including a different user interfaces and features. Thousands of charts have been saved and shared, and a bunch of people have visited the site every day.

üëã I am the creator of Napchart. *I have blood on my hands*

Recently I rolled out a new version with a set of new features:

* **Pen mode** - allows you to create elements by clicking and dragging
* **Choose how many lanes**
* **More colors**

![Some of the new features on Napchart](/content/images/2018/01/Capture.PNG)

Happy and relieved to be finished, I pushed the new version to the website. *Without telling anyone, or showing it to anyone.* The new update was a big mistake.

Don't get me wrong. The new update was a real improvement. But I had forgotten some *essential* features from the previous version.

* The back button (history) was missing
* The lock button was missing!

That's when I realized, I need a closer relationship with the users. I need to listen to the feedback and not *break things*. Let's build this tool together, lets face the hard problems and make the best version of Napchart possible. *For everyone*

## The way forward

First thing I did, was creating the Napchart Blog you are currently reading. Here, I will post announcements and thoughts, I will write new blog posts every time there will be an update.

![Napchart Blog - Shaping the future of Napchart](/content/images/2018/01/Capture-1.PNG)

One thing we also need to do is make a better *feedback and communications system*. Right now, with the feedback form, all feedback is sent right to me. And that's great, but I think it would have been better if the feedback could have been read by *everyone*. Let all of us discuss and share experiences. What works? What doesn't work? This way, we would have better understanding of what is important, and what needs to be done to preserve functionality and user experience.

I am not sure exactly how to do this, but it may or may not include user registration and login on Napchart. This would also open possibilities for other features like saving charts on your profile and collabarating. What is your opinion on this?

So far this is some of the feedback submitted through the form:

* The lock button
* The history back button
* 24 hours / 12 hours (am/pm)
* More lanes than 4?
* Sidebar is misbehaving
* Difficult to read chart (need darker lines)
* Difficult to use on mobile/small screens

![Napchart can be a pain to use on small devices](/content/images/2018/01/094c3029ba08ed2bc2625082a76e3d27-2.jpg)

## How can I contribute

If you are interested in programming, web or javascript, you can contribute directly on GitHub. If you have and idea or an issue, I would love to help you and mentor you to do that yourself.

For non-programmers (most of you I guess) you can still contribute by sending feedback and providing issues and ideas.

* How can Napchart be better?
* How can more people get use of Napchart?
* What do you not like with Napchart? What do you like with Napchart?

Feel free to use the comments below, any feedback appreciated üåü"}]],"sections":[[10,0]]}
posts.html:
Dear Napchart-community,

For a few years now, Napchart has been up and running. It has gone through transformations and upgrades, including a different user interfaces and features. Thousands of charts have been saved and shared, and a bunch of people have visited the site every day.

üëã I am the creator of Napchart. I have blood on my hands

Recently I rolled out a new version with a set of new features:

  • Pen mode - allows you to create elements by clicking and dragging
  • Choose how many lanes
  • More colors

Happy and relieved to be finished, I pushed the new version to the website. Without telling anyone, or showing it to anyone. The new update was a big mistake.

Don't get me wrong. The new update was a real improvement. But I had forgotten some essential features from the previous version.

  • The back button (history) was missing
  • The lock button was missing!

That's when I realized, I need a closer relationship with the users. I need to listen to the feedback and not break things. Let's build this tool together, lets face the hard problems and make the best version of Napchart possible. For everyone

The way forward

First thing I did, was creating the Napchart Blog you are currently reading. Here, I will post announcements and thoughts, I will write new blog posts every time there will be an update.

One thing we also need to do is make a better feedback and communications system. Right now, with the feedback form, all feedback is sent right to me. And that's great, but I think it would have been better if the feedback could have been read by everyone. Let all of us discuss and share experiences. What works? What doesn't work? This way, we would have better understanding of what is important, and what needs to be done to preserve functionality and user experience.

I am not sure exactly how to do this, but it may or may not include user registration and login on Napchart. This would also open possibilities for other features like saving charts on your profile and collabarating. What is your opinion on this?

So far this is some of the feedback submitted through the form:

  • The lock button
  • The history back button
  • 24 hours / 12 hours (am/pm)
  • More lanes than 4?
  • Sidebar is misbehaving
  • Difficult to read chart (need darker lines)
  • Difficult to use on mobile/small screens

How can I contribute

If you are interested in programming, web or javascript, you can contribute directly on GitHub. If you have and idea or an issue, I would love to help you and mentor you to do that yourself.

For non-programmers (most of you I guess) you can still contribute by sending feedback and providing issues and ideas.

  • How can Napchart be better?
  • How can more people get use of Napchart?
  • What do you not like with Napchart? What do you like with Napchart?

Feel free to use the comments below, any feedback appreciated üåü
posts.plaintext:
Dear Napchart-community,

For a few years now, Napchart has been up and running. It has gone through
transformations and upgrades, including a few different takes of the user
interface. Over 20000 charts have been saved and shared, and a bunch of people
have visited the site every day.

I am the creator of Napchart. I have blood on my hands

Recently I rolled out a new version with a set of new features:

 * Pen mode  - allows you to create elements by clicking and dragging
 * Choose how many lanes
 * More colors



Happy and relieved to be finished, I pushed the new version to the website. 
Without telling anyone, or showing it to anyone.  The new update was a big
mistake.

Don't get me wrong. The new update was a real improvement. But I had forgotten
some essential  features from the previous version.

 * The back button (history) was missing
 * The lock button was missing!

That's when I realized, I need a closer relationship with the users. I need to
listen to the feedback and not break things. Let's build this tool together,
lets face the hard problems and make the best version of Napchart possible. For
everyone

The way forward
The first thing we need to do is make a better feedback and communications
system. Right now, with the feedback form, all feedback is sent right to me. And
that's great, but I think it would have been better if the feedback could have
been read by everyone. Let all of us discuss and share experiences. What works?
What doesn't work? This way, we would have better understanding of what is
important, and what needs to be done to preserve functionality and user
experience.

I am not sure exactly how to do this, but it may or may not include user
registration and login on Napchart. This would also open possibilities for other
features like saving charts on your profile and collabarating. What is your
opinion on this? Would it work to make a communication hub/forum/list?

So far (just a few days) this is some of the feedback submitted:

 * The lock button
 * The history back button
 * 24 hours / 12 hours (am/pm)
 * More lanes than 4?
 * Difficult to read chart (darker lines)
 * Sidebar is misbehaving
 * Difficult to use on mobile/small screens



How can I contribute
If you are interested in programming, web or javascript, you can contribute
directly on GitHub. If you have and idea or an issue, I would love to help you
and mentor you to do that yourself.

For non-programmers (most of you I guess) you can still contribute by sending
feedback and providing issues and ideas.

 * How can Napchart be better?
 * How can more people get use of Napchart?

posts.title: Update on text size
posts.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","markups":[],"atoms":[],"cards":[["card-markdown",{"cardName":"card-markdown","markdown":"An issue on [GitHub](https://github.com/larskarbo/napchart/issues/43) by Tinytimrob made me aware that the font size of that the new version of Napchart is darn hard to see on thumb previews on sites like Discord.

Previous version vs new version:

![687474703a2f2f7777772e74696e7974696d726f622e636f6d2f6d656469612f7468756d626e61696c5f636f6d70617269736f6e2e706e67-1](/content/images/2018/01/687474703a2f2f7777772e74696e7974696d726f622e636f6d2f6d656469612f7468756d626e61696c5f636f6d70617269736f6e2e706e67-1.png)

This is a major accessibility issue, as people have to click every link in order to see how the chart is instead of seeing most of the information in the thumb.

## Changes

New version of `napchart` now features a `baseFontSize` config paramater that defaults to `1`. I set the value to `1.5` in thumb creation in `napchart-website`.

Result:

![](/content/images/2018/01/Untitled.png)

Worked great!

Suddenly I also noticed the new version missed the colorTags in the circle of the chartüò®üò®. Luckily, it was an easy fix.

With colorTags enabled:

![](/content/images/2018/01/getImage3.png)


It is a little bit messy, but gives more information. In the future we probably want to have a better text position mechanism to avoid clutter.

Some people also find the font size on the website too small. `baseFontSize` makes it possible to scale the font through the UI too, so that's something I am considering for future releases üëç

PS: super creds to Tinytimrob for implementing the Nap God on the [polyphasic sleep discord group](https://discord.gg/UJcbfby). It is really cool, and is a great way to use Napchart"}]],"sections":[[10,0]]}
posts.html:
An issue on GitHub by Tinytimrob made me aware that the font size of that the new version of Napchart is darn hard to see on thumb previews on sites like Discord.

Previous version vs new version:

This is a major accessibility issue, as people have to click every link in order to see how the chart is instead of seeing most of the information in the thumb.

Changes

New version of napchart now features a baseFontSize config paramater that defaults to 1. I set the value to 1.5 in thumb creation in napchart-website.

Result:

Worked great!

Suddenly I also noticed the new version missed the colorTags in the circle of the chartüò®üò®. Luckily, it was an easy fix.

With colorTags enabled:

It is a little bit messy, but gives more information. In the future we probably want to have a better text position mechanism to avoid clutter.

Some people also find the font size on the website too small. baseFontSize makes it possible to scale the font through the UI too, so that's something I am considering for future releases üëç

PS: super creds to Tinytimrob for implementing the Nap God on the polyphasic sleep discord group. It is really cool, and is a great way to use Napchart
posts.plaintext:
An issue on GitHub [https://github.com/larskarbo/napchart/issues/43]  by
Tinytimrob made me aware that the font size on the new version of Napchart is
darn hard to see on thumb previews on Discourse.

posts.title: New UI and features
posts.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","markups":[],"atoms":[],"cards":[["card-markdown",{"cardName":"card-markdown","markdown":"New update is coming up with some exciting and awaited features. The UI is designed from the bottom up to make Napchart as user friendly as possible.

Thank you for all the feedback you have sent. It has really helped me identified features and pain points that needs to be fixed.

## New UI

![image](/content/images/2018/02/image.png)

The new UI is designed to give the chart as big space as possible. All settings can be found in the menus in the sidebar

## Lock lanes

![image--5-](/content/images/2018/02/image--5-.png)

This is the #1 requested feature. It gives you the ability to lock a whole lane, then drag it around, preserving space between elements.

## AM/PM

![image--2-](/content/images/2018/02/image--2-.png)

Option to switch between AM/PM and military time

## Undo/redo

![image--3-](/content/images/2018/02/image--3-.png)

Undo/redo history feature. Should work well, if not please notify.

## Improved Polyphasic Chooser

![image--4-](/content/images/2018/02/image--4-.png)

The polyphasic schedule chooser is improved and shows total sleep time


Hope you all liked this feature!"}]],"sections":[[10,0]]}
posts.html:
New update is coming up with some exciting and awaited features. The UI is designed from the bottom up to make Napchart as user friendly as possible.

Thank you for all the feedback you have sent. It has really helped me identified features and pain points that needs to be fixed.

New UI

The new UI is designed to give the chart as big space as possible. All settings can be found in the menus in the sidebar

Lock lanes

This is the #1 requested feature. It gives you the ability to lock a whole lane, then drag it around, preserving space between elements.

AM/PM

Option to switch between AM/PM and military time

Undo/redo

Undo/redo history feature. Should work well, if not please notify.

Improved Polyphasic Chooser

The polyphasic schedule chooser is improved and shows total sleep time

Hope you all liked this feature!
posts.plaintext:
New update is coming up with some exciting and awaited features. The UI is
designed from the bottom up to make Napchart as user friendly as possible.

Thank you for all the feedback you have sent. It has really helped me identified
features and pain points that needs to be fixed.

New UI


The new UI is designed to give the chart as big space as possible. All settings
can be found in the menus in the sidebar

Lock lanes


This is the #1 requested feature. It gives you the ability to lock a whole lane,
then drag it around, preserving space between elements.

AM/PM


Option to switch between AM/PM and military time

Undo/redo


Undo/redo history feature. Should work well, if not please notify.

Improved Polyphasic Chooser


The polyphasic schedule chooser is improved and shows total sleep time
